entry.title: Gems You Should Know: Eefgilm
entry.content:
This is an ongoing series where I share gems I think are worth checking out!

Today we will examine a little gem with great power. Eefgilm is a gemfile cleaner that makes the auto generated rails gemfile much easier to read.

From the Eefgilm Github readme:

Eefgilm automatically modifies a ruby gemfile to make them a little easier to read, it does this by alphabetizing the gems, removing all comments, and removing all whitespace including leading and trailing.

How To Use:

Finally, run the eefgilm command from your rails app directory:

and voila! Your gemfile will be beautified!

entry.title: Watch My Presentation on Practical Object Oriented Design in Ruby!
entry.content:
Covering the first three chapters of Sandi Metz’s incredible book.

This is a presentation I gave while studying Ruby on Rails Development at CodeFellows in Seattle, WA. It includes a brief intro to Object Oriented Programming, as well as how to effectively design classes, and also how to manage dependencies.
